title: Ticket #6219: Python Submit interface: '+' attributes not expanded
description:
When using htcondor.Submit in the Python bindings, the value of attributes starting with '+' is not macro-expanded. Example: 

job = htcondor.Submit(JOB_TEMPLATE)
job['+DaskWorkerName'] = '"worker-$(ClusterId).$(ProcId)"'
...
with htcondor.Schedd().transaction() as txn:
  job.queue(txn)
The expected behavior is that DaskWorkerName in the job classad would contain the job's ClusterId and ProcId, but in this case it literally consists of the string "worker-$(ClusterId).$(ProcId)".

If instead of '+', I use 'MY.', as in 

job['MY.DaskWorkerName'] = '"worker-$(ClusterId).$(ProcId)"'
then the right-hand side is properly expanded.
remarks:
2018-Sep-12 11:02:29 by tlmiller:
This was fixed in 8.7 somewhere, and since it has a work-around, we won't be fixing it in 8.6 (with 8.8 being due out soon).
